channel.title: Livakivi
channel.description: Hello. I make videos primarily to share thoughts about various topics I find interesting. So far, they've mostly been about language learning, but I have many videos planned about other topics as well, such as art, programming, games, and so on!
channel.itunes:author: Livakivi
channel.itunes:subtitle: Livakivi
channel.itunes:summary: Hello. I make videos primarily to share thoughts about various topics I find interesting. So far, they've mostly been about language learning, but I have many videos planned about other topics as well, such as art, programming, games, and so on!

item.title: I Tried an Ortholinear Keyboard (Keychron Q15 Max)
item.description:
I finally tried an ortholinear keyboard for the first time in my life, and this video is my report on how it went.
Keyboards featured (non-affiliate links): Keychron Q15 Max: https://www.keychron.com/products/keychron-q15-max-qmk-wireless-custom-mechanical-keyboard?variant=41607379845209 Keychron K2 HE: https://www.keychron.com/products/keychron-k2-he-wireless-magnetic-switch-keyboard
CHAPTERS: 00:00 Normal keyboards are staggered 1:00 Ortholinear keyboards vs normal keyboards 1:55 Split-spacebar keyboard update 2:25 WPM on a staggered board 2:55 Keychron Q15 Max overview 4:15 First reaction to ortholinear 4:37 Keychron Q15 Max feel 4:50 Sound test 5:10 WPM on an ortholinear board 5:55 Ortholinear first thoughts 6:25 Strange layout of the Keychron Q15 Max 9:13 Concerns and assumptions 11:53 Keychron K2 HE mini rundown 12:20 Keychron K2 HE sound test + thoughts 13:17 Time to daily drive the ortholinear board 13:43 Ortholinear WPM after some days 14:15 Surprisingly easy to get used to/switch between non-ortho 14:45 Ortholinear doesn't make much of a difference, but.. 16:30 Why I won't keep daily driving this keyboard 18:55 The split spacebar 19:55 I like the kb, but too many dealbreakers 20:45 Rip my staggered WPM
________________________________ Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/Livakivi Migaku reflink (1 extra month for free + support the channel): https://migaku.io/free-month/Livakivi
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Livakivi Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/Livakivi Discord: https://discord.com/invite/w6qyB5mpWa Second Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/BudgetLivakivi

I finally tried an ortholinear keyboard for the first time in my life, and this video is my report on how it went.
Keyboards featured (non-affiliate links): Keychron Q15 Max: https://www.keychron.com/products/keychron-q15-max-qmk-wireless-custom-mechanical-keyboard?variant=41607379845209 Keychron K2 HE: https://www.keychron.com/products/keychron-k2-he-wireless-magnetic-switch-keyboard

item.title: Why I'm Going to Stop Using Anki for Learning Japanese
item.description:
After 25,000 Anki cards for learning Japanese, I'm done. (for real this time).
CHAPTERS: 00:00 I reached 25,000 Japanese Words/Anki cards! 00:20 I'm going to stop at 25,000 01:30 It's no longer practical 02:35 Limited time budget for learning 03:15 My goals/values have changed 4:10 Anki is still effective, but.. 4:25 Anki is a binding responsibility 5:00 Don't sacrifice your life for hobby language learning 5:30 The last 300 "words"
MUSIC: Croc Legend Of The Gobbos - Main Menu Yugioh OST - illusion OSRS OST - Venture Brad Sucks - Borderline Web: https://www.bradsucks.net Spotify: https://spoti.fi/2BCUEUE Brad's Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/bradsucks (Licensed under CC BY-SA: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ Source: https://bradsucks.net)
